1.text: Preheat the oven to 425 °F (218 °C) and rinse 2 salmon fillets under cold water.

2.text: Pat the salmon dry and brush each side with melted butter.

3.text: Put the fillets skin-side down into a pan and season the fish.

4.text: Cover the baking dish and cook the salmon for 10 minutes.

5.text: Uncover the salmon and bake it for another 20 to 25 minutes.

6.text: Remove the salmon and rest it for 3 minutes before serving.

7.text: Heat a skillet over medium-high and rinse 2 salmon fillets under cold water.

8.text: Pat the salmon fillets with a paper towel and brush them with oil.

9.text: Place the fillets in the skillet and cook them for 3 to 4 minutes.

10.text: Flip the fillets and season them.

11.text: Cover the skillet and cook the salmon for 5 to 8 minutes over medium heat.

12.text: Rest the salmon for 3 minutes before you serve it.

13.text: Heat a gas or charcoal grill to high.

14.text: Rinse 2 frozen salmon fillets under cold water.

15.text: Pat the salmon dry and brush it with olive oil.

16.text: Season your salmon with 1 tablespoon (6 g) of a dry rub.

17.text: Lay the salmon on the grill and cook it for 3 to 4 minutes.

18.text: Flip the salmon and grill it for another 3 to 4 minutes.

19.text: Remove the salmon once it reaches 145 °F (63 °C) and rest it for 3 minutes.
